Assembler
Class Tables

java.lang.Object
  Assembler.Tables

public class Tables
extends Object

This class contains the public fields needed to store information throughout both passes of assembly.

Author:
Ben Trivett

Field Detail

machineOpTable

public HashMap<String,char[]> machineOpTable
The machineOpTable is a hash map with the key being a string of the instruction and the value as a character array. The format of the array is as follows: Position 0: hex value of instruction Position 1: 0,1,2,3 depending on the number of operands the instruction has

psuedoOpTable

public HashMap<String,Integer> psuedoOpTable
The pseudoOpTable is a hash map with the key being the instruction as a string and the value of the number of operands as an integer.

externalSymbolTable

public HashMap<String,String> externalSymbolTable
The externalSymbolTable is a hash map that has the label as the string key and the value as a hex string.

symbolLocationTable

public HashMap<String,String> symbolLocationTable
The symbolLocationTable is a hash map that is similar to the externalSymbolTable although it only contains the entry symbols of the file being parsed through.

symbolTable

public HashMap<String,String[]> symbolTable
The symbolTable is a hash map that has the label as the string key and the value as a string array. The format of the array is as follows: Position 0: A hex string representing the location/value of that label Position 1: 0 for absolute or 1 for relative Position 2: 0 if the number stored was hex, 1 for decimal, 2 for register, 3 for binary

literalTable

public HashMap<String,String[]> literalTable
The literalTable is a hash map with the key being xHEX or #DEC as a string. The value in the map is a string array with pos 0 being the hex value of the literal (string length 4).

passOnePgoffsetCheck

public HashMap<String,Integer[]> passOnePgoffsetCheck
This sets a value of the last 9 bits of the value concatenated with the first seven bits of the location couner.

locationCounter

public Integer locationCounter
The locationCounter is represented as an integer.

initialLocationCounter

public static Integer initialLocationCounter

isRelative

public Boolean isRelative
Is a boolean that is set to true if it is relative and false if it is absolute.

isSymbolRelative

public Boolean isSymbolRelative
Is a boolean that is set to true if a .BLKW statement has been encountered with a symbol as its operand.

startingLocation

public String startingLocation
Stores the starting location as a 4 character string.

startOfLiteralTable

public Integer startOfLiteralTable
The location that the literal table starts.

MAX_SYMBOLS

public final Integer MAX_SYMBOLS
Sets the max symbols.

MAX_LITERALS

public final Integer MAX_LITERALS
Sets the max literals.

MAX_RECORDS

public final Integer MAX_RECORDS
Sets the max records.

Tables

public Tables()
This is a constructor method that creates an instance of each map and variable.
